name: grass seed production, Swiss integrated production, at farm | grass seed, Swiss integrated production, at farm | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8403/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of grass seed (fresh matter). The yield is 1000 kg/ha at a moisture content at storage of 10%.;;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

This activity assumes co-production of grass seeds and forage on an intensive temporary meadow during one year. Included in the dataset are (a)  those operations which can be explicitly attributed to seed production and (b) other inputs and the emissions with a share of 50% of the burden of the whole production system, attributing the other 50% to forage production. The activity starts with the soil cultivation and sowing after the harvest of the previous crop. The inputs of seeds, mineral fertilisers and pesticides are considered. Farm manure as an organic fertiliser is only accounted for in terms of direct field emissions; all pre-processes are included in the animal production systems.


The dataset includes all machine operations and corresponding machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, sowing, fertilisation, pest control, harvest, transport from field to regional processing center (10 km) and drying of seeds. This activity ends after drying of the seeds at the regional processing center.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0119:Growing of other non-perennial crops

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Values refer to the situation in Switzerland.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data derived from literature, recommendations and expert information

Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 5.10E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description:
Burden of grass seed production is approximated by 50% of the burden of  co-production of grass seed and grass for forage on an intensive temporary meadow. For details see '01_crop production - seed production & processing_v1.0.pdf' - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent (www.ecoinvent.org/documentation).
This exchange has an activity link directly to the producing activity because the product is primarily consumed in the same geographical area where it is produced.
